intro: Godetia amoena var. typica, commonly known as the common godetia, is an annual flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers with prominent purple markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and ovate, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
